p:
First, under present conditions, air transportation systems are inhibiting timely access to definitive medical care, as well as reliable and regular access to many communities. To reduce sensitivity, weather observations and forecasts need to be reliably and regularly available, runways length needs to be appropriate for community needs and growing transport demand, and instrument approaches need to be improved and more widely available given that weather conditions and surrounding terrain often limit the ability of aircraft to safely land in communities across Inuit Nunangat
13 .
